div1.p: Carroll's application into the Medical Corps of the Army is approved, although Carroll is technically too old. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter fragment from Henry P. McCain to the Surgeon General, October 2, 1902
div1.p:
respects his age be not reckoned
a bar to his appointment as
Assistant Surgeon, U.S. Army.

War Department,
Adjutant General's Office,
Washington, D.C., October 2, 1902.

Respectfully returned to the
Surgeon General of the Army.

The application of Contract Sur-
geon James Carroll, U. S. Army, for
authority to appear before the Army
Medical Board, for examination with
a view to his appointment in the
Medical Corps of the Army, is approv-
ed. The age limit will be waived
in this case.
By order of the Secretary of War:
div1.closer:
Henry P. McCain
Assistant Adjutant General.
Rec'd back S.G.O. OCT 3 1902
